p: In addition to these spraying methods, biosurfactant chemical characterization can also be quantitatively determined with some staining assays such as Bradford and Anthrone, were performed for cell-free supernatant. Bradford assay is special to detect and quantify amino acids and bovine serum albumin was used as calibration standard ( 5). Anthrone reagent is special to detect and quantify the amount of glycolipid and for preparation of standard curve, a pure sample of glycolipid is used ( 15).
